SharedWorker.summary: The SharedWorker interface represents a specific kind of worker that can be accessed from several browsing contexts, such as several windows, iframes or even workers. They implement an interface different than dedicated workers and have a different global scope, .

blockquote.para: If SharedWorker can be accessed from several browsing contexts, all those browsing contexts must share the exact same origin (same protocol, host and port).

SharedWorkerError.summary: The error event of the interface fires when an error occurs in the worker.

SharedWorkerPort.summary:
The port property of the
interface returns a object used to communicate and control
the shared worker.

SharedWorkerSharedWorker.summary:
The SharedWorker() constructor creates a
object that executes the script at the specified URL. This
script must obey the same-origin policy.

blockquote.para:
There is disagreement among browser manufacturers about
whether a data URL is of the same origin or not. Although Firefox 10.0
and later accept data URLs, that's not the case in all other
browsers.
